main event: Two flat oval objects with a pulsing glow were observed for 1 minute in the Netherlands on 4 August 1954. The observation was made using ground-radar.
interesting points: The objects were initially thought to be searchlight beams, but they were described as flat ovals with a pulsing glow, moving at an intermittent speed.
The duration of the observation was 30 seconds, and the objects were seen to move at a tremendous speed before disappearing.
Rev. Richard M.H. provided information about the sighting and brought out pictures, but they were unable to capture a photograph due to the speed at which the objects moved.
The investigator considered the possibility of a weather balloon but ultimately expressed doubt about this explanation.
The report card notes that there was insufficient data for analysis, suggesting some level of ambiguity in the observation.
sighted object: two flat oval objects with a pulsing glow
